html:
These Amazon price drops are swinging lower than Spider-Man.

Get your popcorn ready, because the Spider-Verse 2-Movie Collector's Edition just dropped to a staggering $44.99 at Amazon for Black Friday — a whopping 63% discount from its original retail price. The limited edition bundle was released last year for $119.99, but fans who purchase now will save $75 and get access to an assortment of bonus merchandise.

4K UHD + Blu-ray + Digital

Spider-verse 2-Movie Collector's Edition

It’s easily one of the most competitive Black Friday deals we’ve found on the online retailer, given the expansive list of products that make up the collection. For starters, this four-disc bundle comes with Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse on 4K UHD and Blu-ray for the ultimate high-definition, web-slinging experience.

But that’s just scratching the surface of this curated set. Aside from the movies, those who purchase will receive a 7" vinyl with two songs from the Across the Spider-Verse soundtrack, comic book art cards, and an exclusive replica of hero Miles Morales’ sketchbook.

If you’re not interested in bonus merchandise, the sequel film is also on sale for just $10.99. The original movie, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse remains set at a list price of $39.96. At this point, it’s more cost effective for Spider-Man fans to purchase the collector’s edition than it would be to cop both UHD and Blu-ray bundles for each individual film. (It makes for a better gift, too.)

With Amazon’s “Black Friday Week” well underway, there’s plenty of other deals on snag-worthy movie bundles for film buffs to choose from, including the Dune 2-Film Collection and a limited edition Star Trek box set. Be sure to check out IGN’s highlights of this year’s top Amazon deals to save on a wide variety of products this holiday season.

Check Out More Movie Deals

When is Black Friday 2024?

We’re less than a week out from Black Friday on November 29, the long-awaited day of massive price cuts across the most popular retailers. Some sites started offering discounts as early as the beginning of the month, but each day leading up to Black Friday brings plenty of new offers. Besides movies, there’s plenty of deals worth checking out for video games on all consoles and Apple devices — from Apple Watches to iPads.

Katie Reul is a freelance journalist whose entertainment reporting has been featured in IGN and Variety.
